comment: Decade later still can't believe what a waste of time this was.

Once you get past his intimidating demeanor, he really is a good guy.  Don't BS him, he talks about BS detection on day 1, and he's derned good at it, so don't even try.  Workload = lots of case write-ups and plenty of small assignments.  You'll stay busy but work in groups so its not that bad.  Don't skip, participate in lecture and you'll be fine
Horrible experience, I could not believe how a professor would make fun of accents of international students.
Was one of the worst classes I took
He needs to write a book! He's wise beyond his (many) years. Great guy. Great stories to tell. Learned a lot about a somewhat dry topic.
Interesting professor. PLEASE don't be late for class or miss a day of class. Also most of your grade will come from group projects so choose your group wisely.
Tough. Realistic. Intriguiging.  Wise ol' codger!  This is the kind of professor you admire and remember...
One of the best professors I have ever had.  I learned a lot in his class and use it with my job.  Not an easy class  and has a ton of work, but it is worth it.
No Comments

Dr. Manners is a very interesting speaker.  His method of talking does keep you interested.  The information that he prepares in the handouts is very usefull.  Be very careful though when entering into Managerial accounting, that is a brutal time in class.  Also, do not miss class.  His statement is "be ontime ready to play."  He is serious.
Excellent concepts.  Learned alot.  Has practicle experience.

The "Dumbledore of KSU" Ha..Ha!  I'll second that.  Tons of work.  Has an accute b.s. sniffer so don't show up to class late or unprepared.  Pretty interesting and profound individual.  Certainly kept me on my toes all semester.

Manners is the Albus Dumbledore of KSU. Show up and pay attention -ask questions if you need help. There is a lot of material to read and write for this class and spreadsheets to construct so make sure you have the time to devote to it. I came away from this class with a ton of immediately useful info and models. It was definitely worth the time&$.

This is a very time consuming class.  We had to write 19, 1-paged, singled spaced case notes, and the mid term was 2 5-paged papers that had a 10 day writing period.  If you want to get something out of your MBA, take him but if you just want a degree, take someone else.

Mannors and Lasher make one of the best teams I have ever seen. Mannors will make you work your butt off for your grade and is very tough but if you want to learn this is the teacher to take. One of the best.

Loaded with insight & experience, Manners brings real MBA material with great presentation skills.  Cases will really make you think.  If you apply yourself you will know something when you leave his class. Actually made accounting interesting. As an experienced manager I view manners a one of the best@KSU for helping your career. Slackers, beware.

Tough, but fair. He's got a lot of good stuff to teach, and wants you to come up with exactly what he's thinking. This is often hard to do with his assignments. Definitely be on time and don't be late with assignments, otherwise you'll get a ZERO!
Do not be late to class!!!!  He is extremely caring and knowledgeable.  A great professor!
HE is the main educational influence in my life.  This man is demanding, fair and caring about students future.  He IS the MAN!
He has a bad temper and attitude.  He has a lot to offer if you are one of his pets.  If not, you will get completely lost in the class.
Very knowledgable.  Gives you great content with great presentation skills.  Demanding, but fair.  You will learn a lot in his class
One of the best.  This guy is very sharp.  Worth every penny.
